agt¶

The Alexa Gadgets Toolkit Python API allows you to build fun and delightful accessories that pair to compatible Echo devices via Classic Bluetooth or Bluetooth Low Energy. These accessories can extend Alexa’s capabilities to new modalities with motors, lights, sound chips, and more.

from agt import AlexaGadget

class MyFirstGadget(AlexaGadget):
    def on_alexa_gadget_statelistener_stateupdate(self, directive):
        print("STATE UPDATED: ", directive)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    MyFirstGadget().main()
class agt.AlexaGadget(gadget_config_path=None)[source]¶

An Alexa-connected accessory that interacts with an Amazon Echo device over Classic Bluetooth or Bluetooth Low Energy.

main()[source]¶

Main entry point.

start()[source]¶

Start gadget event loop.

is_paired()[source]¶

Return true if this gadget has a Echo device BT address in config and bonded, false otherwise

is_connected()[source]¶

Return true if a Bluetooth connection to an Echo device is active, false otherwise

set_discoverable(discoverable=True)[source]¶

Sets whether or not an Echo device can discover and pair to this Gadget

reconnect()[source]¶

Reconnect to the paired Echo device.

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnects, but does not un-pair, from the Echo device

send_custom_event(namespace, name, payload)[source]¶

Send a custom event to the skill

Parameters

  • namespace – namespace of the custom event

  • name – name of the custom event

  • payload – JSON payload of the custom event

send_event(event)[source]¶

Send an event to the Echo device

Depending on your the capabilities your gadget supports, you may call this method with one of the following events:

  • Alexa.Discovery.Discover.Response

    • param: DiscoverResponseEventProto.Event

on_connected(device_addr)[source]¶

Called when the Gadget connects to the paired Echo device.

Parameters

device_addr – the address of the device we connected to

on_disconnected(device_addr)[source]¶

Called when the Gadget disconnects from the paired Echo device.

Parameters

device_addr – the address of the device we disconnected from

on_directive(directive)[source]¶

Called when the Gadget receives a directive from the connected Echo device.

By default, this method will call the appropriate callback method if it is defined.

Depending on your the capabilities your gadget supports, this method may be called with for the following directives:

  • Alexa.Gadget.StateListener.StateUpdate

    • param: StateUpdateDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_alexa_gadget_statelistener_stateupdate(directive)

  • Notifications.SetIndicator

    • param: SetIndicatorDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_notifications_setindicator(directive)

  • Notifications.ClearIndicator

    • param: ClearIndicatorDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_notifications_clearindicator(directive)

  • Alexa.Gadget.SpeechData.Speechmarks

    • param: SpeechmarksDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_alexa_gadget_speechdata_speechmarks(directive)

  • Alexa.Gadget.MusicData.Tempo

    • param: TempoDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_alexa_gadget_musicdata_tempo(directive)

  • Alerts.SetAlert

    • param: SetAlertDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_alerts_setalert(directive)

  • Alerts.DeleteAlert

    • param: DeleteAlertDirectiveProto.Directive

    • callback: on_alerts_deletealert(directive)
